Another thing that Shane and I

is something called an impedance mismatch.
Basically, if you have something squishy,
and you have something rigid

and they hit the amount of
time, it takes to compress them
and then relax,

leads to a less efficient
elastic collision.
So basically,
you want to match the rigidity
of the objects that are colliding,

so that they can compress
and relax at the same time,
and you get a more efficient collision.
